title: Jurisdictions and Law
summary: Level 2 explores the distinctions between air, land, and sea jurisdictions and reveals how corporate systems extended maritime law onto the land. It reinforces the importance of consent, lawful awareness, and public law authority.

questions.question: Which law form governs commerce and activity on the sea?
Which law governs living men and women on the land?
Which jurisdiction relates to spiritual and ecclesiastical matters?
What determines which jurisdiction applies to a man or woman?
options: Their consent and declared political status

questions.question: What are the three primary jurisdictions recognized in lawful teachings?
Who holds lawful authority under land jurisdiction?
options: The living men and women of the Assembly

questions.question: What is created through birth registration under corporate law?
options: A legal PERSON or corporate fiction

questions.question: Why do corporate courts often claim jurisdiction over people?
options: Because individuals appear as the PERSON instead of the living being
Because maritime law controls all territory
Because it is required by citizenship

questions.question: Which law form stands above all others on Earth?
What symbol often represents maritime jurisdiction in courtrooms?
options: A flag with a gold fringe

questions.question: What principle defines lawful behavior under Common Law?
options: Do no harm, cause no loss, keep the peace

questions.question: Why is lawful notice required before any action is taken?
options: Because no one can be held to a law or claim they were not informed of
Because it helps the postal system

questions.question: What is the purpose of Public Law?
options: To uphold peace, fairness, and the rights of living people

questions.question: Why are statutory codes considered private law?
options: Because they apply only to corporations and members who consent to them

questions.question: What distinguishes a public court of record?
options: It operates under Common Law with accountability to the people
It is based on maritime codes
It reports to a private franchise

questions.question: What restores a man or woman to the land and soil jurisdiction?
options: Recording a Deed of Re-Conveyance and Status Correction

questions.question: What is the highest duty of lawful government?
options: To protect life, rights, and property under Public Law

questions.question: In commerce, why is silence often taken as agreement?
options: Because unrebutted claims stand as truth in law
Because silence means consent in all cases
Because it is a modern convenience

questions.question: What proves that an Assembly is operating lawfully?
options: It is unincorporated and serves living people under Public Law

questions.question: How can individuals remain under the correct jurisdiction?
options: By living peacefully and lawfully within the land and soil Assembly
By registering all property under maritime law
